subject: Sleep
title: Sleep and Religion
description: A micro-lesson that makes Sleep and Religion usable.

hook.text: Almost every religion has something to say about sleep. Most of them see it as a minor death and rehearsal for the afterlife.

buildup.text: Islam prescribes sleeping on the right side and reciting prayers before bed. Buddhism uses mindful awareness as sleep approaches.

discovery.text: In Christianity, monastic schedules divided the night into prayer vigils, breaking sleep into intentional segments.

twist.text: Hindu scriptures describe different states of consciousness during sleep, anticipating modern sleep stage science by millennia.

climax.text: Religion shaped sleep habits for billions of people, often overriding biological rhythms with spiritual schedules.

punchline.text: For most of history, God decided when you slept.

quiz.question: How did monastic life affect sleep patterns?
options: Night was divided into prayer vigils, breaking sleep into segments
